body:
# rosegold

Minecraft client written in [Crystal](http://crystal-lang.org/), following the [botting rules](https://civwiki.org/wiki/Botting#Botting_Rules) of [CivMC](https://civwiki.org/wiki/CivMC)

### Rosegold is a custom Minecraft botting client with the following goals:

1. **Efficiency and accessibility**: Rosegold aims to make botting accessible to all Civ users by providing a clean and easy-to-understand DSL for creating bots, while also ensuring that the client remains efficient.
2. **Headless with a headful feel (coming soon)**: Although Rosegold is a headless client, it seeks to address the limitations of current bots by providing a proxy that allows a standard vanilla Minecraft client to connect, spectate, and control. This approach offers the benefits of headless clients while maintaining a headful user experience.
3. **Compliance with server-specific botting rules**: Rosegold is designed for use on servers with specific botting rules, such as CivMC, which restrict bots from seeing or hearing. The client makes it challenging to create bots that violate these rules, ensuring a fair gameplay experience.
4. **Portable and easy-to-distribute**: Leveraging Crystal's ability to compile into portable binaries, Rosegold aims to simplify the distribution process for developers, making it easier to set up and manage bots for their nations.


## How to Start Writing Bots

1. `crystal init app <nameforyourbotrepo>`
1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     rosegold:
       github: grepsedawk/rosegold.cr
       version: ~> 0.4
   ```
1. Run `shards install`
1. Start with a basic example by writing a file in `src/`, something like...

   ```crystal
   require "rosegold"
   bot = Rosegold::Bot.join_game("play.civmc.net")
   sleep 3

   while bot.connected?
     bot.eat!
     bot.yaw = -90
     bot.pitch = -10
     bot.inventory.pick! "diamond_sword"
     bot.attack
     bot.wait_ticks 20
     puts bot.feet
     puts "Tool durability: #{bot.main_hand.durability} / #{bot.main_hand.max_durability}"
   end
    ```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/grepsedawk/rosegold.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

def.name: to_vec3d
def.body:
case self
when BlockFace::West
  Vec3d.new(-len, 0, 0)
when BlockFace::East
  Vec3d.new(len, 0, 0)
when BlockFace::Bottom
  Vec3d.new(0, -len, 0)
when BlockFace::Top
  Vec3d.new(0, len, 0)
when BlockFace::North
  Vec3d.new(0, 0, -len)
when BlockFace::South
  Vec3d.new(0, 0, len)
else
  raise("Invalid BlockFace #{self}")
end

class_methods.name: prompt_for_login!
class_methods.doc:
Prompts the user to follow Microsoft's Device Flow for OAuth.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-device-code
Returns the access token as a String
class_methods.summary: Prompts the user to follow Microsoft's Device Flow for OAuth.

def.name: prompt_for_login!
def.body:
(JSON.parse((HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/devicecode", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access")).body)).try do |json|
  STDERR.puts(json["message"])

  loop do
    sleep(5.seconds)
    (HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/token", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access&code=#{json["device_code"]}&grant_type=urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code")).body.try do |token_string|
      if (JSON.parse(token_string))["error"]?
        next
      end

      token = Token.from_json(token_string)
      token.expires_at = Time.local.to_unix + token.expires_in

      STDERR.puts("Login successful!")

      return token
    end
  end
end

def.name: refresh
def.body:
if expired?
  refresh!
else
  self
end

def.name: refresh!
def.body:
(HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/token", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access&refresh_token=#{refresh_token}&grant_type=refresh_token")).body
  .try do |json|
    (Token.from_json(json)).tap do |token|
      token.expires_at = Time.local.to_unix + token.expires_in
      token.save
    end
  end

def.name: hexdigest
def.body:
digest = Digest::SHA1.new
yield digest
big = BigInt.new((OpenSSL::BN.from_bin(digest.final)).to_dec)
if (big.bit(159)) == 1
  "-" + (((BigInt.new((big.to_s(2)).gsub({'0' => '1', '1' => '0'}), 2)) + 1).to_s(16))
else
  big.to_s(16)
end

instance_methods.name: read
instance_methods.doc:
Reads at most *slice.size* bytes from this `IO` into *slice*.
Returns the number of bytes read, which is 0 if and only if there is no
more data to read (so checking for 0 is the way to detect end of file).

```
io = IO::Memory.new "hello"
slice = Bytes.new(4)
io.read(slice) # => 4
slice          # => Bytes[104, 101, 108, 108]
io.read(slice) # => 1
slice          # => Bytes[111, 101, 108, 108]
io.read(slice) # => 0
```
instance_methods.summary: Reads at most slice.size bytes from this IO into slice.

def.name: read_var_int
def.body:
result = 0_u32
shift = 0
loop do
  b = read_byte
  result = result | (((127 & b).to_u32) << shift)
  if (b & 128) == 0
    return result
  end
  shift = shift + 7
  if shift >= 32
    raise("VarInt is too big: #{shift}")
  end
end

def.name: read_var_long
def.body:
result = 0_u64
shift = 0
loop do
  b = read_byte
  result = result | (((127 & b).to_u64) << shift)
  if (b & 128) == 0
    return result
  end
  shift = shift + 7
  if shift >= 64
    raise("VarLong is too big: #{shift}")
  end
end

def.body:
a = Array(UInt8).new
more = true
while more
  b = (value & 127).to_u8
  value = value >> 7
  if value == 0
    more = false
  else
    b = b | 128
  end

  a << b
end
write(a.to_unsafe.to_slice(a.size))

def.name: read
def.body:
tags = Hash(String, Tag).new

loop do
  name = ""
  tag = Tag.read(io) do |tag_type|
    if tag_type == 0
    else
      name = (StringTag.read(io)).value
    end
  end

  if tag.is_a?(EndTag)
    return new(tags)
  end

  tags[name] = tag
end

def.name: write
def.body:
if value.empty?
  io.write_byte(0_u8)
  io.write_full(0)
  return
end

io.write_byte(value.first.tag_type)
io.write_full(value.size.to_i32)

value.each do |tag|
  tag.write(io)
end

def.name: read_named
def.body:
name = ""
tag = Tag.read(io, tag_type) do
  if tag_type == 0
  else
    name = (StringTag.read(io)).value
  end
end

{name, tag}

def.name: read
def.body:
yield tag_type

case tag_type
when 0
  EndTag.read(io)
when 1
  ByteTag.read(io)
when 2
  ShortTag.read(io)
when 3
  IntTag.read(io)
when 4
  LongTag.read(io)
when 5
  FloatTag.read(io)
when 6
  DoubleTag.read(io)
when 7
  ByteArrayTag.read(io)
when 8
  StringTag.read(io)
when 9
  ListTag.read(io)
when 10
  CompoundTag.read(io)
when 11
  IntArrayTag.read(io)
when 12
  LongArrayTag.read(io)
else
  Log.warn do "Unsupported NBT tag type: #{tag_type}, skipping" end

  EndTag.read(io)
end

def.name: ray_intersection
def.body:
begin
  direction = end_ - start
  t_min = Vec3d.new((self.min.x - start.x) / direction.x, (self.min.y - start.y) / direction.y, (self.min.z - start.z) / direction.z)

  t_max = Vec3d.new((self.max.x - start.x) / direction.x, (self.max.y - start.y) / direction.y, (self.max.z - start.z) / direction.z)

  t_min_x, t_max_x = [t_min.x, t_max.x].min, [t_min.x, t_max.x].max
  t_min_y, t_max_y = [t_min.y, t_max.y].min, [t_min.y, t_max.y].max
  t_min_z, t_max_z = [t_min.z, t_max.z].min, [t_min.z, t_max.z].max

  t_near = [t_min_x, t_min_y, t_min_z].max
  t_far = [t_max_x, t_max_y, t_max_z].min

  if t_near > t_far
    return nil
  end
  if t_far < 0
    return nil
  end

  t_near
rescue e : ArgumentError
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: break_damage
instance_methods.args_string: (main_hand : Slot, player : Player, creative : Bool = false) : Float64
instance_methods.args_html: (main_hand : Slot, player : Player, creative : Bool = false) : Float64

def.name: break_damage
def.body:
if creative
  return 0_f64
end

speed_multiplier = 1.0
if best_tool?(main_hand)
  speed_multiplier = material_tool_multipliers[main_hand.item_id_int.to_s].as_f
  if main_hand.efficiency > 0
    speed_multiplier = speed_multiplier + ((main_hand.efficiency ** 2) + 1)
  end
end





if haste = player.effect_by_name("haste")
  speed_multiplier = speed_multiplier * (1.0 + (0.2 * (haste.amplifier + 1)))
end

if !player.on_ground?
  speed_multiplier = speed_multiplier / 5
end

damage = speed_multiplier / hardness
damage = damage / (can_harvest?(main_hand) ? 30 : 100)

if damage > 1
  return 1_f64
end

damage

def.body:

if break_damage.zero?
  return 0
end

(1.0 / break_damage).ceil.to_i

def.name: can_harvest?
def.body:
if harvest_tools.nil?
  return true
end

(best_tool?(slot)) || harvest_tools.try do |__arg0| __arg0.keys.includes?(slot.item_id_int.to_s) end

def.name: eat!
def.body:
if food >= 15 && full_health?
  return
end
if food >= 18
  return
end

Log.info do "Eating because food is #{food} and health is #{health}" end

(
  (
    (
      (inventory.pick("apple")) ||
      (inventory.pick("baked_potato"))
    ) ||
    (inventory.pick("bread"))
  ) ||
  (inventory.pick("carrot"))
) ||
(raise("Bot food not found"))

start_using_hand

while !food >= 18
  wait_ticks(33)
end

stop_using_hand

Log.info do "Eating finished, food is #{food} and health is #{health}" end

instance_methods.doc:
Jumps and waits until the bot is `height` above the ground.
Fails if the bot lands before reaching this height.
instance_methods.summary: Jumps and waits until the bot is height above the ground.

def.name: jump_by_height
def.body:
target_y = feet.y + height
prev_y = feet.y
client.physics.jump_queued = true
timeout_ticks.times do
  wait_tick
  if feet.y >= target_y
    break
  end
  if prev_y == feet.y
    raise("Cannot jump up #{height}m at #{feet}")
  end

def.name: land_on_ground

ticks_remaining = timeout_ticks

  if ticks_remaining <= 0
    raise("Still falling after #{timeout_ticks} ticks")
  end
end

end

instance_methods.name: send_command
instance_methods.doc: Send a command with proper signing

def.name: send_command
def.body:
command_text = command.starts_with?('/') ? command[1..] : command

packet = Serverbound::ChatCommand.new(command_text)

begin
  client.send_packet!(packet)
  true
rescue e : Exception
  Log.error do "Failed to send chat command (#{e.class} - #{e.message}): #{command}" end
  false
end

instance_methods.name: send_message
instance_methods.doc: Send a regular chat message with proper signing and acknowledgment
instance_methods.summary: Send a regular chat message with proper signing and acknowledgment

def.name: send_message
def.body:
if message.bytesize > 256
  return false
end

timestamp = Time.utc.to_unix_ms
salt = Random.new.rand(Int64::MIN..Int64::MAX)
signature = nil


if has_private_key? && (key = @private_key)
  signature = generate_message_signature(message, timestamp, salt, key)
end


acknowledged = create_acknowledged_bitset


checksum = calculate_checksum(message, timestamp, salt)


packet = Serverbound::ChatMessage.new(message: message, timestamp: timestamp, salt: salt, signature: signature, message_count: @message_count, acknowledged: acknowledged, checksum: checksum)

begin
  client.send_packet!(packet)
  increment_message_index
  true
rescue e : Exception
  Log.error do "Failed to send chat message: #{e}" end
  false
end

and control state (physics, open window, etc.).
Can be reconnected.

def.name: status
def.body:
io = Minecraft::IO::Wrap.new(TCPSocket.new(host, port))
connection = Connection::Client.new(io, ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING, Client.protocol_version)

connection.send_packet(Serverbound::Handshake.new(Client.protocol_version, host, port, 1))
connection.protocol_state = ProtocolState::STATUS

connection.send_packet(Serverbound::StatusRequest.new)
packet = connection.read_packet


if packet.is_a?(Clientbound::StatusResponse)
  packet
elsif packet.is_a?(Rosegold::Clientbound::RawPacket)
  Log.warn do "Received raw packet instead of StatusResponse: #{packet.bytes.inspect}" end
  Log.warn do "State: #{connection.protocol_state.name}, Protocol: #{Client.protocol_version}" end
  raise("Unexpected packet type: #{packet.class}")
else
  raise("Unexpected packet type: #{packet.class}")
end

def.name: connect
def.body:
if connected?
  raise(NotConnected.new("Already connected"))
end

authenticate!


detect_and_set_protocol_version

io = Minecraft::IO::Wrap.new(TCPSocket.new(host, port))
connection = @connection = Connection::Client.new(io, ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING, protocol_version, self)
@current_protocol_state = ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING
connection.handler.try(&.on(Event::Disconnected) do |_event|
  physics.handle_disconnect
end)
Log.info do "Connected to #{host}:#{port}" end

send_packet!(Serverbound::Handshake.new(protocol_version, host, port, 2))
set_protocol_state(ProtocolState::LOGIN)

queue_packet(Serverbound::LoginStart.new(player.username.not_nil!, player.uuid, protocol_version))

spawn do
  begin
    while connected?
      read_packet
    end
  rescue e : IO::Error
    Log.debug do "Stopping reader: #{e}" end
  end
end

def.name: start_ticker
def.body:
spawn do
  loop do
    sleep(tick_interval)

    if connected?
    else
      break
    end


    should_tick = if @ticking_frozen
      if @pending_tick_steps > 0
        @pending_tick_steps = @pending_tick_steps - 1
        true
      else
        false
      end
    else
      true
    end

    if should_tick
      spawn do
        interactions.tick
        physics.tick
        emit_event(Event::Tick.new)
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: transfer_to
def.body:
Log.info do "Initiating transfer to #{new_host}:#{new_port}" end

old_connection = @connection
old_host = @host
old_port = @port

Log.debug do "Preserving #{@cookies.size} cookies for transfer" end

old_connection.try do |conn|
  if conn.open?
    Log.debug do "Disconnecting from current server for transfer" end
    conn.disconnect(Chat.new("Transferring to #{new_host}:#{new_port}"))
  end
end

@host = new_host
@port = new_port.to_i
@connection = nil
@current_protocol_state = ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING

begin
  Log.info do "Connecting to new server #{new_host}:#{new_port}" end
  connect
  Log.info do "Transfer to #{new_host}:#{new_port} completed successfully" end
rescue e
  Log.error do "Transfer failed during connection to #{new_host}:#{new_port}: #{e.message}" end
  @host = old_host
  @port = old_port
  @connection = nil
  raise(e)
end

if start_time
else
  return

client.chunk_batch_start_time = nil

def.name: read
def.body:
chunk_x = io.read_int
chunk_z = io.read_int


heightmaps_count = io.read_var_int
heightmaps = Array(Heightmap).new(heightmaps_count) do Heightmap.read(io) end


data = io.read_var_bytes


block_entities_count = io.read_var_int
block_entities = Array(Chunk::BlockEntity).new(block_entities_count) do
  xz = io.read_byte
  Chunk::BlockEntity.new(chunk_x + ((xz >> 4) & 15), io.read_short, chunk_z + (xz & 15), io.read_var_int, io.read_nbt_unamed)
end


light_data = io.getb_to_end

self.new(chunk_x, chunk_z, heightmaps, data, block_entities, light_data)

def.name: new
def.body:
heightmaps = [Heightmap.new(1_u32, [] of Int64)]
light_data = if chunk.light_data.empty?
  LightData.new
else
  LightData.read(Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(chunk.light_data))
end
self.new(chunk.x, chunk.z, heightmaps, chunk.data, chunk.block_entities, light_data)

def.name: callback
def.body:
source = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(data)
chunk = Chunk.new(chunk_x, chunk_z, source, client.dimension)
chunk.block_entities = block_entities
chunk.heightmaps = Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag.new
chunk.light_data = light_data
client.dimension.load_chunk(chunk)

if client.physics.paused?
  spawn_chunk_x = client.player.feet.x.to_i >> 4
  spawn_chunk_z = client.player.feet.z.to_i >> 4
  if (chunk_x == spawn_chunk_x) && (chunk_z == spawn_chunk_z)
    client.physics.unpause_for_spawn_chunk
    Log.debug do "Spawn chunk loaded - physics unpaused" end
  end
end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |io|
  io.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  io.write_full(chunk_x)
  io.write_full(chunk_z)


  io.write(heightmaps.size.to_u32)
  heightmaps.each(&.write(io))


  io.write(data.size)
  io.write(data)


  io.write(block_entities.size)
  block_entities.each do |block_entity|
    io.write((((block_entity.x & 15) << 4) | (block_entity.z & 15)).to_u8)
    io.write_full(block_entity.y.to_i16)
    io.write(block_entity.type)
    io.write(block_entity.nbt)
  end


  light_data.write(io)
end.to_slice

def.name: read
def.body:
if Client.protocol_version >= 767_u32
  begin
    reason_nbt = packet.read_nbt_unamed
    chat = nbt_to_chat(reason_nbt)
    self.new(chat)
  rescue
    Log.warn do "Failed to parse disconnect reason as NBT, trying as string" end
    reason_string = begin
      packet.read_var_string
    rescue
      "Unknown disconnect reason"
    end
    self.new(Chat.new(reason_string))
  end
else
  reason_json = packet.read_var_string
  begin
    self.new(Chat.from_json(reason_json))
  rescue JSON::ParseException
    Log.warn do "Failed to parse disconnect reason as JSON: #{reason_json.inspect}" end
    self.new(Chat.new(reason_json))
  end
end

def.name: read
def.body:
nbt_type = packet.read_byte

message = if nbt_type == 8
  text = packet.read_var_string
  Rosegold::Chat.new(text)
else
  Rosegold::Chat.new("Complex text component")
end


chat_type_id = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
if chat_type_id == 0
  packet.read_var_string

  param_count = packet.read_var_int
  param_count.times do
    packet.read_var_int
  end

  style_nbt_type = packet.read_byte
  if style_nbt_type != 0
  end
end


sender_nbt_type = packet.read_byte
sender_name = if sender_nbt_type == 8
  text = packet.read_var_string
  Rosegold::Chat.new(text)
else
  Rosegold::Chat.new("Server")
end


target_name = nil
if packet.read_bool
  target_nbt_type = packet.read_byte
  target_name = if target_nbt_type == 8
    text = packet.read_var_string
    Rosegold::Chat.new(text)
  else
    Rosegold::Chat.new("Target")
  end
end

self.new(message, chat_type_id, sender_name, target_name)

def.name: callback
def.body:
entity = client.dimension.entities[entity_id]?
effect = Rosegold::EntityEffect.new(effect_id, amplifier, duration, flags)

if client.player.entity_id == entity_id
  if existing_effect = client.player.effects.find do |active_effect| active_effect.effect == effect.effect end
    existing_effect.amplifier = amplifier
    existing_effect.duration = duration
    existing_effect.flags = flags
    return
  end

  client.player.effects << effect
end

if entity.nil?
  Log.warn do "Received entity effect packet for unknown entity ID #{entity_id}" end
  return
end

if existing_effect = entity.effects.find do |active_effect| active_effect.effect == effect.effect end
  existing_effect.amplifier = amplifier
  existing_effect.duration = duration
  existing_effect.flags = flags
  return
end

entity.effects << effect

def.name: valid?
def.body:
slots = [main_hand, off_hand, boots, leggings, chestplate, helmet]
  .select(&.try(&.present?))
!slots.empty?

def.name: write
def.body:
slots = [main_hand, off_hand, boots, leggings, chestplate, helmet]
  .map_with_index do |slot, i| {slot, i.to_u8} end
  .select do |slot, _| slot && slot.present? end
if slots.empty?
  raise("Cannot write empty EntityEquipment")
end
_, last_i = slots.last
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(entity_id)
  slots.each do |slot, i|
    if i == last_i
    else
      i = i | 128
    end
    buffer.write(i)
    buffer.write(slot.not_nil!)
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do "Received entity position and rotation packet for entity ID #{entity_id}, delta X #{delta_x}, delta Y #{delta_y}, delta Z #{delta_z}, yaw #{yaw}, pitch #{pitch}" end
entity = client.dimension.entities[entity_id]?

if entity.nil?
  Log.warn do "Received entity position and rotation packet for unknown entity ID #{entity_id}" end
  return
end

new_pos = entity.position.plus((delta_x / 128.0) / 32.0, (delta_y / 128.0) / 32.0, (delta_z / 128.0) / 32.0)
entity.position = new_pos
entity.yaw = yaw
entity.pitch = pitch
entity.on_ground = on_ground?

  buffer.write(delta_x)
  buffer.write(delta_y)
  buffer.write(delta_z)
  buffer.write(yaw)
  buffer.write(pitch)

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(entity_id)

  buffer.write(dimension_names.size)

  buffer.write(max_players)

  buffer.write(reduced_debug_info?)

  buffer.write(do_limited_crafting?)
  buffer.write(dimension_type)
  buffer.write(dimension_name)
  buffer.write_full(hashed_seed)
  buffer.write(gamemode)
  buffer.write(previous_gamemode)
  buffer.write(is_debug?)
  buffer.write(is_flat?)
  buffer.write(has_death_location?)
  if has_death_location?
    buffer.write(death_dimension_name.not_nil!)
    buffer.write(death_location.not_nil!)
  end
  buffer.write(portal_cooldown)
  buffer.write(sea_level)
  buffer.write(enforces_secure_chat?)
end.to_slice

def.body:

  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))

  buffer.write(username)

    buffer.write(properties.size)

      buffer.write(prop.name)
      buffer.write(prop.value)

      else
        buffer.write(false)
      end
    end
  end

def.name: read
def.body:
section_pos_bits = packet.read_long

section_y = ((section_pos_bits << 44) >> 44).to_i32
section_z = ((section_pos_bits << 22) >> 42).to_i32
section_x = (section_pos_bits >> 42).to_i32

block_states = Array(Tuple(Int32, Int32, Int32, UInt16)).new(packet.read_var_int) do
  long = packet.read_var_long
  y = (section_y * 16) + (long & 15).to_u8
  z = (section_z * 16) + ((long >> 4) & 15).to_u8
  x = (section_x * 16) + ((long >> 8) & 15).to_u8
  block_state = (long >> 12).to_u16
  {x, y, z, block_state}
end

self.new(section_x, section_y, section_z, block_states)

def.name: read
def.body:
global_index = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
sender = packet.read_uuid
index = packet.read_var_int.to_u32


signature = nil
if packet.read_bool
  signature = Bytes.new(256)
  packet.read_fully(signature)
end


message = packet.read_var_string
timestamp = packet.read_long
salt = packet.read_long


previous_count = packet.read_var_int
previous_messages = Array(Bytes).new(previous_count)
previous_count.times do
  message_id = packet.read_var_int
  msg_signature = if packet.read_bool
    sig = Bytes.new(256)
    packet.read_fully(sig)
    sig
  else
    Bytes.empty
  end
  if msg_signature.empty?
  else
    previous_messages << msg_signature
  end
end


unsigned_content = nil
if packet.read_bool
  unsigned_content = Rosegold::Chat.from_json(packet.read_var_string)
end


filter_type = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
filter_mask = nil
if filter_type == 2_u32
  mask_size = (message.bytesize + 7) // 8
  filter_mask = Bytes.new(mask_size)
  packet.read_fully(filter_mask)
end


chat_type = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
network_name = Rosegold::Chat.from_json(packet.read_var_string)
network_target_name = nil
if packet.read_bool
  network_target_name = Rosegold::Chat.from_json(packet.read_var_string)
end

self.new(global_index, sender, index, signature, message, timestamp, salt, previous_messages, unsigned_content, filter_type, filter_mask, chat_type, network_name, network_target_name)

constructors.args_html: (global_index : UInt32, sender : UUID, index : UInt32, signature : Slice(UInt8) | Nil, message : String, timestamp : Int64, salt : Int64, previous_messages : Array(Slice(UInt8)), unsigned_content : Nil | Rosegold::Chat, filter_type : UInt32, filter_mask : Slice(UInt8) | Nil, chat_type : UInt32, network_name : Rosegold::Chat, network_target_name : Nil | Rosegold::Chat)

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.info do "[CHAT] #{network_name}: #{message}" end


if sig = signature
  client.chat_manager.add_last_seen_signature(sig)
end
client.chat_manager.increment_message_count

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))


  buffer.write(global_index)
  buffer.write(sender)
  buffer.write(index)


  if sig = signature
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(sig)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end


  buffer.write(message)
  buffer.write_full(timestamp)
  buffer.write_full(salt)


  buffer.write(previous_messages.size.to_u32)
  previous_messages.each do |msg_sig|
    buffer.write(0_u32)
    if msg_sig.size > 0
      buffer.write(true)
      buffer.write(msg_sig)
    else
      buffer.write(false)
    end
  end


  if unsigned = unsigned_content
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(unsigned.to_json)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end


  buffer.write(filter_type)
  if mask = filter_mask
    buffer.write(mask)
  end


  buffer.write(chat_type)
  buffer.write(network_name.to_json)
  if target = network_target_name
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(target.to_json)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: read
def.body:
registry_id = packet.read_var_string


entry_count = packet.read_var_int
entries = Array(NamedTuple(id: String, data: Bytes | ::Nil)).new(entry_count) do
  entry_id = packet.read_var_string
  has_data = packet.read_bool
  data = has_data ? packet.read_var_bytes : nil
  {id: entry_id, data: data}
end

self.new(registry_id, entries)

constructors.args_html: (registry_id : String, entries : Array(NamedTuple(id: String, data: Slice(UInt8) | Nil)) = [] of NamedTuple(id: String, data: Bytes | ::Nil))

def.name: callback
def.body: Log.debug do "Received registry data for #{registry_id} with #{entries.size} entries" end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(registry_id)
  buffer.write(entries.size)
  entries.each do |entry|
    buffer.write(entry[:id])
    if data = entry[:data]
      buffer.write(true)
      buffer.write(data)
    else
      buffer.write(false)
    end
  end
end.to_slice

  buffer.write(sea_level)
  buffer.write(data_kept)
end.to_slice

def.name: read
def.body:
window_id = packet.read_var_int
state_id = packet.read_var_int

num_slots = packet.read_var_int
slots = Array(WindowSlot).new(num_slots) do |slot_number|
  WindowSlot.new(slot_number, Slot.read(packet))
end

cursor = WindowSlot.new(-1, Slot.read(packet))

self.new(window_id, state_id, slots, cursor)

constructors.args_html: (window_id : UInt32, state_id : UInt32, slots : Array(Rosegold::WindowSlot), cursor : Rosegold::WindowSlot)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate

if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)

_

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do "Received #{slots.size} container content for window #{window_id} state #{state_id}" end
if window_id == 0
  client.inventory.state_id = state_id
  client.inventory.slots = slots
  client.inventory.cursor = cursor
elsif client.window.id == window_id
  client.window.state_id = state_id
  client.window.slots = slots
  client.window.cursor = cursor
elsif client.inventory.previous_window_id && (client.inventory.previous_window_id == window_id)
  client.inventory.handle_late_packet(window_id.to_u8, slots: slots, cursor: cursor, state_id: state_id)
else
  Log.warn do "Received container content for an unknown or mismatched window. Ignoring. Packet window_id=#{window_id}, client window_id=#{client.window.id}, previous_window_id=#{client.inventory.previous_window_id}" end
  Log.debug do self end
end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(window_id)
  buffer.write(state_id)
  buffer.write(slots.size.to_u32)
  slots.each do |slot|
    slot.write(buffer)
  end
  cursor.write(buffer)
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
if (window_id == -1) && (slot.slot_number == -1)
  client.window.cursor = slot
elsif window_id == 0
  client.inventory.slots[slot.slot_number] = slot
elsif client.window.id == window_id
  client.window.slots[slot.slot_number] = slot
elsif client.inventory.previous_window_id && (client.inventory.previous_window_id == window_id.to_u8)
  client.inventory.handle_late_packet(window_id.to_u8, slot: slot)
else
  Log.warn do "Received slot update for an unknown or mismatched window. Ignoring. Packet window_id=#{window_id}, client window_id=#{client.window.id}, previous_window_id=#{client.inventory.previous_window_id}, slot=#{slot}" end
  Log.debug do self end
end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(window_id)
  buffer.write(state_id)
  buffer.write_full(slot.slot_number.to_i16)
  buffer.write(slot)
end.to_slice

def.name: read
def.body:
if Client.protocol_version >= 769_u32
  teleport_id = packet.read_var_int
  x = packet.read_double
  y = packet.read_double
  z = packet.read_double
  velocity_x = packet.read_double
  velocity_y = packet.read_double
  velocity_z = packet.read_double
  yaw = packet.read_float
  pitch = packet.read_float
  relative_flags = packet.read_byte

  self.new(x, y, z, yaw, pitch, relative_flags, teleport_id, false, velocity_x, velocity_y, velocity_z)
else
  x = packet.read_double
  y = packet.read_double
  z = packet.read_double
  yaw = packet.read_float
  pitch = packet.read_float
  relative_flags = packet.read_byte
  teleport_id = packet.read_var_int

  self.new(x, y, z, yaw, pitch, relative_flags, teleport_id)
end

def.name: callback
def.body:
player = client.player
player.feet = feet(player.feet)
player.look = look(player.look)


if Client.protocol_version >= 771_u32
  player.velocity = Vec3d.new(velocity_x, velocity_y, velocity_z)
else
  player.velocity = Vec3d::ORIGIN
end

client.queue_packet(Serverbound::TeleportConfirm.new(teleport_id))

Log.debug do "Position synchronized: #{player.feet} #{player.look} flags=#{relative_flags}" end

client.physics.handle_reset

def.name: feet
def.body:
x = sanitize_coordinate(x_raw, -30000000.0, 30000000.0)
y = sanitize_coordinate(y_raw, -20000000.0, 20000000.0)
z = sanitize_coordinate(z_raw, -30000000.0, 30000000.0)

if (relative_flags & 1) != 0
  x = x + previous_feet.x
end
if (relative_flags & 2) != 0
  y = y + previous_feet.y
end
if (relative_flags & 4) != 0
  z = z + previous_feet.z
end

Vec3d.new(x, y, z)

def.name: look
def.body:
yaw = yaw_raw
pitch = pitch_raw

if (relative_flags & 8) != 0
  yaw = yaw + previous_look.yaw
end
if (relative_flags & 16) != 0
  pitch = pitch + previous_look.pitch
end

Look.new(yaw, pitch)

def.name: read
def.body:
type_count = packet.read_var_int
tag_types = Array(TagType).new(type_count) do
  type_name = packet.read_var_string


  tag_count = packet.read_var_int
  tags = Array(NamedTuple(name: String, entries: Array(UInt32))).new(tag_count) do
    tag_name = packet.read_var_string


    entry_count = packet.read_var_int
    entries = Array(UInt32).new(entry_count) do
      packet.read_var_int
    end

    {name: tag_name, entries: entries}
  end

  {type: type_name, tags: tags}
end

def.body:
Log.debug do "Received #{slots.size} window items for window #{window_id} state #{state_id}" end
if window_id == 0
  client.inventory.state_id = state_id
  client.inventory.slots = slots
  client.inventory.cursor = cursor
elsif client.window.id == window_id
  client.window.state_id = state_id
  client.window.slots = slots
  client.window.cursor = cursor
else
  Log.warn do "Received window items for an unknown or mismatched window. Ignoring." end
  Log.debug do self end
end

class_methods.name: decode_clientbound_packet
class_methods.doc: Protocol-aware packet decoding for clientbound packets
class_methods.summary: Protocol-aware packet decoding for clientbound packets
class_methods.args_string: (packet_bytes : Bytes, protocol_state : ProtocolState, protocol_version : UInt32) : Clientbound::Packet

def.name: decode_clientbound_packet
def.body:
(Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(packet_bytes)).try do |pkt_io|
  pkt_id = pkt_io.read_byte || (raise("Empty packet"))

  pkt_type = protocol_state.get_clientbound_packet(pkt_id, protocol_version)


  if log_packet_ids = ENV["LOG_PACKET"]?
    packet_ids_to_log = (log_packet_ids.split(",")).compact_map do |id_str|
      cleaned = id_str.strip
      if (cleaned.starts_with?("0x")) || (cleaned.starts_with?("0X"))
        cleaned[2..].to_u8?(16)
      else
        cleaned.to_u8?
      end
    end

    if packet_ids_to_log.includes?(pkt_id)
      packet_name = pkt_type ? pkt_type.name : "Unknown (0x#{(pkt_id.to_s(16)).upcase})"
      packet_hex = "0x#{(pkt_id.to_s(16)).upcase.rjust(2, '0')}"
      Log.warn do "Logged packet #{packet_name} (#{packet_hex}) in #{protocol_state.name} state for protocol #{protocol_version}" end
      Log.warn do "Packet bytes (#{packet_bytes.size} bytes): #{packet_bytes.hexstring}" end
    end
  end

  if pkt_type && (pkt_type.responds_to?(:read))
  else
    return Clientbound::RawPacket.new(packet_bytes)
  end

  begin
    result = pkt_type.read(pkt_io)
    result
  rescue ex
    packet_name = pkt_type.name
    packet_hex = "0x#{(pkt_id.to_s(16)).upcase.rjust(2, '0')}"

    Log.warn do "Failed to parse clientbound packet #{packet_name} (#{packet_hex}) in #{protocol_state.name} state for protocol #{protocol_version}: #{ex.message}" end
    Log.warn do "Packet bytes (#{packet_bytes.size} bytes): #{packet_bytes.hexstring}" end
    Log.warn do "Exception: #{ex.class}: #{ex.message}" end
    Log.warn do "Stack trace:\n#{ex.backtrace?.try(&.join("\n")) || "No backtrace available"}" end


    Clientbound::RawPacket.new(packet_bytes)
  end
end

def.name: io=
def.body:
read_mutex.synchronize do
  write_mutex.synchronize do
    @io = io
  end
end

def.name: read_raw_packet
def.body:
begin
  if close_reason
    raise(Rosegold::Client::NotConnected.new)
  end

  packet_bytes = Bytes.new(0)
  read_mutex.synchronize do
    if compress?
      frame_len = io.read_var_int
      io.read_fully(frame_bytes = Bytes.new(frame_len))

      frame_io = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(frame_bytes)
      uncompressed_data_len = frame_io.read_var_int
      if uncompressed_data_len == 0
        uncompressed_data_len = frame_len - 1
      else
        frame_io = Compress::Zlib::Reader.new(frame_io)
      end
      frame_io.read_fully(packet_bytes = Bytes.new(uncompressed_data_len))
    else
      io.read_fully(packet_bytes = Bytes.new(io.read_var_int))
    end
  end
  packet_bytes
rescue e
  disconnect(Chat.new("IO Error: #{e.message}"))
  raise_without_backtrace(e)
end

def.name: send_packet
def.body:
begin
  if close_reason
    raise(Rosegold::Client::NotConnected.new)
  end

  (if compress?
    Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
      size = packet_bytes.size

      if size > compression_threshold
        buffer.write(size.to_u32)

        Compress::Zlib::Writer.open(buffer) do |zlib|
          zlib.write(packet_bytes)
        end
      else
        buffer.write(0_u32)
        buffer.write(packet_bytes)
      end
    end.to_slice
  else
    packet_bytes
  end).try do |bytes_compressed|
    write_mutex.synchronize do
      io.write(bytes_compressed.size.to_u32)
      io.write(bytes_compressed)
      io.flush
    end
  end
rescue e
  disconnect(Chat.new("IO Error: #{e.message}"))
  raise_without_backtrace(e)
end

constants.doc: CRC32C polynomial (Castagnoli)

types.doc: CRC32C implementation to match Minecraft's hashedslot hashing

def.name: checksum
def.body:
crc = ~0_u32
data.each do |byte|
  index = (crc ^ byte) & 255
  crc = (crc >> 8) ^ CRC32C_TABLE[index]
end
~crc

def.name: read
def.body:
lore_count = io.read_var_int
lore = Array(String).new
lore_count.times do
  nbt = io.read_nbt_unamed

  lore_text = case nbt
  when Minecraft::NBT::StringTag
    nbt.value
  when Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag
    text = nbt["text"]?.try() do |__arg1| (__arg1.as(Minecraft::NBT::StringTag)).value end || ""
    extra_text = ""
    if extra = nbt["extra"]?
      if extra.is_a?(Minecraft::NBT::ListTag)
        extra.value.each do |item|
          if item.is_a?(Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag)
            extra_text = extra_text + (item["text"]?.try() do |__arg2| (__arg2.as(Minecraft::NBT::StringTag)).value end || "")
          end
        end
      end
    end
    text + extra_text
  else
    "Unknown"
  end
  lore << lore_text
end
new(lore)

instance_methods.name: raycast_entity
instance_methods.args_string: (start : Vec3d, look : Vec3d, max_distance : Float64) : Entity | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (start : Vec3d, look : Vec3d, max_distance : Float64) : Entity | Nil

def.name: raycast_entity
def.body:
closest_entity = nil
closest_distance = Float64::INFINITY

ray_end = start + (look * max_distance)

entities.each_value do |entity|
  if entity.living?
  else
    next
  end

  bounding_box = entity.bounding_box
  distance = bounding_box.ray_intersection(start, ray_end)
  if distance.nil?
    next
  end

  if distance < closest_distance
    closest_entity = entity
    closest_distance = distance
  end
end

closest_entity

def.name: bounding_box
def.body:
if metadata = self.metadata
  half_width = metadata.width / 2.0

  min = Vec3d.new(position.x - half_width, position.y, position.z - half_width)
  max = Vec3d.new(position.x + half_width, position.y + metadata.height, position.z + half_width)

  AABBd.new(min, max)
else
  half_size = 0.5
  min = Vec3d.new(position.x - half_size, position.y, position.z - half_size)
  max = Vec3d.new(position.x + half_size, position.y + 1, position.z + half_size)

  AABBd.new(min, max)
end

def.name: update_passengers
def.body:
passenger_ids.each do |passenger_id|
  if client.player.entity_id == passenger_id
    client.player.feet = position
  elsif entity = client.dimension.entities[passenger_id]?
    entity.position = position
  end
end

instance_methods.name: wait_for
instance_methods.doc:
Waits for an event, if timeout is given, it will return nil
if the timeout is reached before the event is emitted.
instance_methods.summary: Waits for an event, if timeout is given, it will return nil if the timeout is reached before the event is emitted.
instance_methods.args_string: (event_type : T.class, timeout : Time::Span | Nil = nil) forall T
instance_methods.args_html: (event_type : T.class, timeout : Time::Span | Nil = nil) forall T

def.name: wait_for
def.body:
ran_event = nil
time_start = Time.utc

once(event_type) do |event|
  ran_event = event
end

while !ran_event
  if timeout && (Time.utc - time_start) > timeout
    return nil
  end
  sleep(0.01.seconds)
end

ran_event

types.name: HashedSlot
types.doc: Hashed slot format used in ClickContainer packet
types.summary: Hashed slot format used in ClickContainer packet

def.name: from_slot
def.body:
if slot.empty?
  new(false)
else
  hashed_components = Hash(UInt32, UInt32).new
  slot.components_to_add.each do |component_type, component|
    component_buffer = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new
    component_buffer.write(component_type)
    component.write(component_buffer)
    component_data = component_buffer.to_slice
    crc32_hash = CRC32C.checksum(component_data)
    hashed_components[component_type] = crc32_hash
  end

  new(true, slot.item_id_int, slot.count, hashed_components, slot.components_to_remove)
end

constructors.args_string: (has_item : Bool = false, item_id_int : UInt32 = 0_u32, count : UInt32 = 0_u32, components_to_add : Hash(UInt32, UInt32) = Hash(UInt32, UInt32).new, components_to_remove : Set(UInt32) = Set(UInt32).new)
constructors.args_html: (has_item : Bool = false, item_id_int : UInt32 = 0_u32, count : UInt32 = 0_u32, components_to_add : Hash(UInt32, UInt32) = Hash(UInt32, UInt32).new, components_to_remove : Set(UInt32) = Set(UInt32).new)

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(has_item)
if has_item
else
  return
end

io.write(item_id_int)
io.write(count)


io.write(components_to_add.size)
components_to_add.each do |component_type, hash|
  io.write(component_type)
  io.write_full(hash.to_u32)
end


io.write(components_to_remove.size)
components_to_remove.each do |component_type|
  io.write(component_type)
end

Returns the number of matching items in the player inventory (inventory + hotbar), or in the given slots range.

Example:
  inventory.count "diamond_pickaxe" # => 2
  inventory.count &.empty? # => 2
  inventory.count { |slot| slot.name == "diamond_pickaxe" && slot.efficiency >= 4 } # => 1
  inventory.count "stone", slots # => 5 (count in entire window including container)
instance_methods.summary: Returns the number of matching items in the player inventory (inventory + hotbar), or in the given slots range.

instance_methods.name: deposit_at_least
instance_methods.doc:
Tries to transfer at least `count` matching items from the container to the player inventory, using shift-clicking.
Returns the number of actually transferred items.

Example:
  inventory.deposit_at_least 5, "diamond_pickaxe" # => 3
  inventory.deposit_at_least 5, &.empty?, hotbar # => 1
  inventory.deposit_at_least 5, { |slot| slot.name == "diamond_pickaxe" && slot.efficiency >= 4 } # => 2
instance_methods.summary: Tries to transfer at least #count matching items from the container to the player inventory, using shift-clicking.
instance_methods.args_string: (count, spec, source : Array(WindowSlot) = inventory + hotbar, target : Array(WindowSlot) = content)
instance_methods.args_html: (count, spec, source : Array(WindowSlot) = inventory + hotbar, target : Array(WindowSlot) = content)

instance_methods.name: pick
instance_methods.doc:
Picks a matching slot, if it exists in the inventory.
Returns true if the item was picked, false otherwise.

Example:
  inventory.pick "diamond_pickaxe" # => true
  inventory.pick &.empty? # => true
  inventory.pick { |slot| slot.name == "diamond_pickaxe" && slot.efficiency >= 4 } # => false
instance_methods.summary: Picks a matching slot, if it exists in the inventory.

def.name: pick
def.body:
if (main_hand.matches?(spec)) && !main_hand.needs_repair?
  return true
end

hotbar.each_with_index do |slot, index|
  if (slot.matches?(spec)) && !slot.needs_repair?
    client.player.hotbar_selection = index.to_u8
    return true
  end
end

slots.each do |slot|
  if (slot.matches?(spec)) && !slot.needs_repair?
    swap_hotbar(client.player.hotbar_selection, slot)
    return true
  end
end

false

instance_methods.name: replenish
instance_methods.doc:
Ensures the player has at least `count` items of the specified type in their inventory.
If there are already enough items, returns the current count.
If not enough items are present, attempts to withdraw more from a container.
Returns the total count after replenishment attempt.

Example:
  inventory.replenish 10, "stone" # => 10 (if successful)
  inventory.replenish 5, "diamond" # => 3 (if only 3 available)
instance_methods.summary: Ensures the player has at least #count items of the specified type in their inventory.

def.name: replenish
def.body:
current_count = count(item_id, inventory + hotbar)
if current_count >= count
  return current_count
end

current_count + (withdraw_at_least(count - current_count, item_id))

quantity = 0
slots.each do |slot|
  if slot.name == name
  else
    next
  end
  quantity = quantity + slot.count

  client.send_packet!(Serverbound::ClickWindow.new(:drop, 1_i8, slot.slot_number.to_i16, [] of WindowSlot, client.window.id.to_u8, client.window.state_id.to_i32, client.window.cursor))
end

quantity

types.name: Look
types.doc:
The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane has 0 at (0, 1), 90 at (-1, 0), 180 at (0, -1) and 270 at (1, 0).

Yaw is not clamped to between 0 and 360; any number is valid, including negative numbers and numbers greater than 360.

Pitch 0 is looking straight ahead, -90 is looking straight up, and 90 is looking straight down.

There are an infinite number of "down"/"up" looks with different yaw; use e.g. `NORTH.down`.
types.summary: The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane has 0 at (0, 1), 90 at (-1, 0), 180 at (0, -1) and 270 at (1, 0).

def.name: from_rad
def.body:
yaw = (yaw_rad * 360) / Math::TAU
pitch = (pitch_rad * 360) / Math::TAU
Look.new(yaw.to_f32, pitch.to_f32)

def.name: from_vec
def.body:
yaw_rad = Math.atan2(-vec.x, vec.z)
ground_distance = Math.sqrt((vec.x * vec.x) + (vec.z * vec.z))
pitch_rad = -(Math.atan2(vec.y, ground_distance))

Look.from_rad(yaw_rad.to_f32, pitch_rad.to_f32)

macros.name: packet_ids
macros.doc:
Macro to define protocol-specific packet IDs for a packet class
Usage: packet_ids({758 => 0x00_u8, 767 => 0x01_u8, 771 => 0x01_u8})
macros.summary: Macro to define protocol-specific packet IDs for a packet class Usage: packet_ids({758 => 0x00_u8, 767 => 0x01_u8, 771 => 0x01_u8})

def.name: packet_ids
def.body:
# Store the protocol mappings as a constant

    PROTOCOL_PACKET_IDS = 
{{ mappings }}


    
# Generate the [](protocol_version) method for elegant access

    def self.[](protocol_version : UInt32) : UInt8
      PROTOCOL_PACKET_IDS[protocol_version]?.try(&.to_u8) || default_packet_id
    
end

    
# Provide backward compatibility with existing packet_id class getter

    
# Use the first protocol's packet ID for registration compatibility

    class_getter packet_id : UInt8 = 
{{ mappings.values.first }}
.to_u8

    
# Get packet ID for specific protocol version

    def self.packet_id_for_protocol(protocol_version : UInt32) : UInt8
      self[protocol_version]
    
end

    
# Define default packet ID (typically the latest/most common version)

    def self.default_packet_id : UInt8
      
# Use the first defined packet ID as default

      
{% first_id = mappings.values.first %}

      
{{ first_id }}
.to_u8
    
end

    
# Helper method to get all supported protocols

    def self.supported_protocols : Array(UInt32)
      [
{{ mappings.keys.splat }}
].map(&.to_u32)
    
end

    
# Helper method to check if a protocol is supported

    def self.supports_protocol?(protocol_version : UInt32) : Bool
      PROTOCOL_PACKET_IDS.has_key?(protocol_version)
    
end

types.name: PalettedContainer
types.doc:
Four modes:
Single state: All entries are the same value. The value is stored as palette[0]. The long_array is empty.
Encoded: The long_array stores the palette index of each value.
Direct: The long_array stores values directly. The palette is empty.
types.summary: Four modes: Single state: All entries are the same value.

constructors.name: air_filled
constructors.doc: Creates a container filled with air/default values (ID 0)
constructors.summary: Creates a container filled with air/default values (ID 0)

def.body:
long_array = self.long_array
if long_array.empty?
  return palette[0]
end


if index >= size
  return 0_u16
end

long_index = index // entries_per_long
if long_index >= long_array.size
  return 0_u16
end

bit_offset_in_long = (index % entries_per_long) * bits_per_entry
value = long_array[long_index] >> bit_offset_in_long
value = (value & entry_mask).to_u16
if palette.empty?
  return value
end


if value >= palette.size
  return 0_u16
end
palette[value]

if long_array.empty?
  if palette[0] == value
    return
  else
    grow_from_single_state
  end
end
if palette.empty?
  encoded = value
else
  encoded = palette.index(value)
  if encoded
  else
    max_palette_size = 1_u64 << bits_per_entry
    if (palette.size + 1) >= max_palette_size
      grow_palette
    end
    encoded = palette.size
    palette << value
    encoded
  end
end
encoded = encoded.to_u64!
long_index = index // entries_per_long
bit_offset_in_long = (index % entries_per_long) * bits_per_entry
long = long_array[long_index]
long = long & (~(entry_mask << bit_offset_in_long))
long = long | ((encoded & entry_mask) << bit_offset_in_long)
long_array[long_index] = long

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(bits_per_entry)
if bits_per_entry == 0
  io.write(palette[0])

  if Client.protocol_version >= 772_u32
  else
    io.write(0)
  end
  return
end
if palette.empty?
else
  io.write(palette.size)
  palette.each do |id| io.write(id) end
end

if Client.protocol_version >= 772_u32
else
  io.write(long_array.size)
end
long_array.each do |id| io.write_full(id) end

class_methods.name: get_grown_obstacles
class_methods.doc:
Returns all block collision boxes that may intersect `entity_aabb` during the movement from `start` by `vec`,
including boxes 0.5m higher for stepping.
`entity_aabb` is at 0,0,0; the returned AABBs are grown by `entity_aabb` so collision checks are just raytracing.
class_methods.summary: Returns all block collision boxes that may intersect entity_aabb during the movement from start by vec, including boxes 0.5m higher for stepping.
class_methods.args_string: (start : Vec3d, movement : Vec3d, entity_aabb : AABBf, dimension : Dimension) : Array(AABBd)
class_methods.args_html: (start : Vec3d, movement : Vec3d, entity_aabb : AABBf, dimension : Dimension) : Array(AABBd)

def.name: get_grown_obstacles
def.body:
entity_aabb = entity_aabb.to_f64
grow_aabb = entity_aabb * -1

bounds = AABBd.containing_all(entity_aabb.offset(start), entity_aabb.offset(start + movement))

min_block = (bounds.min.down(0.5)).block

max_block = (bounds.max.up(0.5)).block
blocks_coords = Indexable.cartesian_product({(min_block.x..max_block.x).to_a, (min_block.y..max_block.y).to_a, (min_block.z..max_block.z).to_a})
blocks_coords.flat_map do |block_coords|
  x, y, z = block_coords
  (dimension.block_state(x, y, z)).try do |block_state|
    block_shape = MCData::DEFAULT.block_state_collision_shapes[block_state]
    block_shape.map do |__arg9| (__arg9.to_f64.offset(x, y, z)).grow(grow_aabb) end
  end || (Array(AABBd).new(0))
end

Applies collision handling including stepping.
Returns adjusted movement vector and adjusted post-movement velocity.

class_methods.name: predict_movement_collision
class_methods.doc:
Applies collision handling including stepping.
Returns adjusted movement vector and adjusted post-movement velocity.
class_methods.summary: Applies collision handling including stepping.
class_methods.args_html: (start : Vec3d, velocity : Vec3d, obstacles : Array(AABBd))

def.name: predict_movement_collision
def.body:
obstacles = obstacles.reject(&.contains?(start))

movement = slide(start, velocity, obstacles)
collided_x = movement.x != velocity.x
collided_y = movement.y != velocity.y
collided_z = movement.z != velocity.z

if collided_x || collided_z
  step_up_movement = slide(start, Vec3d.new(0, 0.5, 0), obstacles)
  step_up = start + step_up_movement

  over_velocity = velocity.with_y(0)
  step_over_movement = slide(step_up, over_velocity, obstacles)

  step_different_x = step_over_movement.x != movement.x
  step_different_z = step_over_movement.z != movement.z
  if step_different_x || step_different_z
    step_over = step_up + step_over_movement
    down_velocity = Vec3d.new(0, velocity.y - step_up_movement.y, 0)
    down_end = step_over + (slide(step_over, down_velocity, obstacles))
    movement = down_end - start
    collided_x = movement.x != velocity.x
    collided_y = true
    collided_z = movement.z != velocity.z
  end
end

new_velocity = velocity
if collided_x
  new_velocity = new_velocity.with_x(0)
end
if collided_y
  new_velocity = new_velocity.with_y(0)
end
if collided_z
  new_velocity = new_velocity.with_z(0)
end

{movement, new_velocity}

Set the movement target location and wait until it is achieved.

def.name: move
def.body:
if paused?
  Log.warn do "Ignoring movement to #{target} because physics is paused" end
  return
end

if very_close_to?(target)
  replace_movement_action(nil)
  return
end

if target == nil
  replace_movement_action(nil)
  return
end

action = Action(Vec3d).new(target)
replace_movement_action(action)

@consecutive_stuck_ticks = 0
@last_position = nil
@current_stuck_timeout_ticks = stuck_timeout_ticks
action.join

def.name: sneak
def.body:
if player.sneaking? == sneaking
  return
end

if sneaking
  sprint(false)
  @player_input_flags = @player_input_flags | Serverbound::PlayerInput::Flag::Sneak
else
  @player_input_flags = @player_input_flags & (~Serverbound::PlayerInput::Flag::Sneak)
end


client.send_packet!(Serverbound::PlayerInput.new(@player_input_flags))
player.sneaking = sneaking

def.name: sprint
def.body:
if player.sneaking?
  return
end

if player.sprinting? == sprinting
  return
end
if sprinting
  client.send_packet!(Serverbound::EntityAction.new(player.entity_id, Serverbound::EntityAction::Type::StartSprinting))
else
  client.send_packet!(Serverbound::EntityAction.new(player.entity_id, Serverbound::EntityAction::Type::StopSprinting))
end
player.sprinting = sprinting

def.name: tick
def.body:
if paused?
  return
end
if client.connected?
else
  return
end

input_velocity = velocity_for_inputs

movement, next_velocity = Physics.predict_movement_collision(player.feet, input_velocity, current_player_aabb, dimension)

look_action = action_mutex.synchronize do
  action = @look_action
  @look_action = nil
  action
end
look = look_action.try(&.target) || player.look

feet = player.feet + movement

feet = feet.with_y(feet.y.round(4))


on_ground = movement.y > input_velocity.y


if action = @movement_action
  if last_pos = @last_position
    if (feet - last_pos).length < 0.001
      @consecutive_stuck_ticks = @consecutive_stuck_ticks + 1


      if @current_stuck_timeout_ticks > 0 && @consecutive_stuck_ticks >= @current_stuck_timeout_ticks
        action.fail(MovementStuck.new("Movement stuck for #{@current_stuck_timeout_ticks} consecutive ticks at #{feet}"))
        @movement_action = nil
      end
    else
      @consecutive_stuck_ticks = 0
    end
  end


  @last_position = feet
end


should_send_packet = (movement_changed?(feet, look, on_ground)) ||
ticks_since_last_packet >= MOVEMENT_PACKET_KEEP_ALIVE_INTERVAL

if should_send_packet
  send_movement_packet(feet, look, on_ground)
  @ticks_since_last_packet = 0
else
  @ticks_since_last_packet = @ticks_since_last_packet + 1

  player.feet = feet
  player.look = look
  player.on_ground = on_ground
end

player.velocity = next_velocity

action_mutex.synchronize do
  look_action.try(&.succeed)

  @movement_action.try do |movement_action|
    if very_close_to?(movement_action.target)
      movement_action.succeed
      @movement_action = nil
    end
  end
end

client.emit_event(Event::PhysicsTick.new(movement))

instance_methods.doc: Handle late packets from a closed window by temporarily recreating and closing it
instance_methods.summary: Handle late packets from a closed window by temporarily recreating and closing it
instance_methods.args_string: (window_id : UInt8, slots : Array(WindowSlot) | Nil = nil, slot : WindowSlot | Nil = nil, cursor : WindowSlot | Nil = nil, state_id : UInt32 = 0)
instance_methods.args_html: (window_id : UInt8, slots : Array(WindowSlot) | Nil = nil, slot : WindowSlot | Nil = nil, cursor : WindowSlot | Nil = nil, state_id : UInt32 = 0)

def.name: handle_late_packet
def.body:
Log.debug do "Handling late packet for previous window #{window_id}" end


temp_window = Window.new(@client, window_id, Chat.new("Late Window"), 0_u32)


if slots
  temp_window.state_id = state_id
  temp_window.slots = slots
  if cursor
    temp_window.cursor = cursor
  end
elsif slot
  temp_window.slots = Array.new(54) do |i| WindowSlot.new(i, Slot.new) end

  if slot.slot_number >= 0 && slot.slot_number < temp_window.slots.size
    temp_window.slots[slot.slot_number] = slot
  else
    Log.debug do "Ignoring SetSlot for out-of-bounds slot #{slot.slot_number}" end
    return
  end
end


current_window = @client.window
@client.window = temp_window


temp_window.handle_closed


@client.window = current_window

class_methods.args_html: (start : Vec3d, delta : Vec3d, boxes : Array(AABBd)) : Result | Nil

def.name: raytrace
def.body:
min_scalar = 1_f64
min_result = nil

if ray.delta.x < 0
  boxes.each_with_index do |box, box_nr|
    min_scalar, min_result = better(ray, box, box.max.x, BlockFace::East, min_scalar, min_result, box_nr)
  end
end
if ray.delta.x > 0
  boxes.each_with_index do |box, box_nr|
    min_scalar, min_result = better(ray, box, box.min.x, BlockFace::West, min_scalar, min_result, box_nr)
  end
end
if ray.delta.y < 0
  boxes.each_with_index do |box, box_nr|
    min_scalar, min_result = better(ray, box, box.max.y, BlockFace::Top, min_scalar, min_result, box_nr)
  end
end
if ray.delta.y > 0
  boxes.each_with_index do |box, box_nr|
    min_scalar, min_result = better(ray, box, box.min.y, BlockFace::Bottom, min_scalar, min_result, box_nr)
  end
end
if ray.delta.z < 0
  boxes.each_with_index do |box, box_nr|
    min_scalar, min_result = better(ray, box, box.max.z, BlockFace::South, min_scalar, min_result, box_nr)
  end
end
if ray.delta.z > 0
  boxes.each_with_index do |box, box_nr|
    min_scalar, min_result = better(ray, box, box.min.z, BlockFace::North, min_scalar, min_result, box_nr)
  end
end

min_result

def.name: read
def.body:
message = io.read_var_string
timestamp = io.read_long
salt = io.read_long
signature = nil
if io.read_bool
  signature = Bytes.new(256)
  io.read_fully(signature)
end
message_count = io.read_var_int

acknowledged = Bytes.new(3)
io.read_fully(acknowledged)
checksum = io.read_byte

self.new(message, timestamp, salt, signature, message_count, acknowledged, checksum)

constructors.args_string: (message : String, timestamp : Int64 = Time.utc.to_unix_ms, salt : Int64 = Random.new.rand(Int64::MIN..Int64::MAX), signature : Bytes | Nil = nil, message_count : UInt32 = 0_u32, acknowledged : Bytes = Bytes.new(3, 0), checksum : UInt8 = 0_u8)
constructors.args_html: (message : String, timestamp : Int64 = Time.utc.to_unix_ms, salt : Int64 = Random.new.rand(Int64::MIN..Int64::MAX), signature : Bytes | Nil = nil, message_count : UInt32 = 0_u32, acknowledged : Bytes = Bytes.new(3, 0), checksum : UInt8 = 0_u8)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(message, timestamp, salt, signature, message_count, acknowledged, checksum)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|

  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(message)
  buffer.write_full(timestamp)
  buffer.write_full(salt)
  if signature
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(signature.not_nil!)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end
  buffer.write(message_count)

  buffer.write(acknowledged)
  buffer.write(checksum)
end.to_slice

end

constructors.args_html: (mode : Rosegold::Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode, button : Int8, slot_number : Int16, changed_slots : Array(Rosegold::WindowSlot), window_id : UInt8, state_id : Int32, cursor : Rosegold::Slot)

def.body:

if _.responds_to?(:finalize)

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(window_id)
  buffer.write(state_id)
  buffer.write_full(slot_number)
  buffer.write(button)
  buffer.write(mode.value)
  buffer.write(changed_slots.size)
  changed_slots.each do |slot|
    buffer.write_full(slot.slot_number.to_i16)

    hashed_slot = HashedSlot.from_window_slot(slot)
    hashed_slot.write(buffer)
  end

  hashed_cursor = HashedSlot.from_slot(cursor)
  hashed_cursor.write(buffer)
end.to_slice

def.name: digest
def.body:
Minecraft::Digest.hexdigest do |digest|
  digest << encryption_request.server_id
  digest << shared_secret
  digest << encryption_request.public_key
end

def.name: send_join_request!
def.body:
response = send_join_request
if response.status_code == 204
else
  raise("Join Request Failed: #{response.inspect}")
end

def.name: write
def.body:
send_join_request!

(OpenSSL::PKey::RSA.new(IO::Memory.new(("-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\n" + (Base64.encode(encryption_request.public_key))) + "-----END PUBLIC KEY-----\n"))).try do |key|
  Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
    buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))

    (key.public_encrypt(shared_secret)).try do |encrypted_secret|
      buffer.write(encrypted_secret.size.to_u32)
      buffer.write(encrypted_secret)
    end

    (key.public_encrypt(encryption_request.verify_token)).try do |encrypted_nonce|
      buffer.write(encrypted_nonce.size.to_u32)
      buffer.write(encrypted_nonce)
    end
  end.to_slice
end

constructors.args_html: (entity_id : UInt64, action : Action, target_x : Float32 | Nil = nil, target_y : Float32 | Nil = nil, target_z : Float32 | Nil = nil, hand : Hand | Nil = nil, sneaking : Bool = false)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(entity_id)
  buffer.write(action.value)

  if action == Action::InteractAt
    buffer.write(target_x.not_nil!)
    buffer.write(target_y.not_nil!)
    buffer.write(target_z.not_nil!)
  end

  if (action == Action::Interact) || (action == Action::InteractAt)
    buffer.write(hand.not_nil!.value)
  end

  buffer.write(sneaking?)
end.to_slice

types.doc:
Player Loaded packet
Sent by the client to indicate that it is ready to start simulating the player.
The vanilla client sends this when the "Loading terrain..." screen is closed.

The vanilla client skips ticking the player entity until the tick on which this packet is sent.
Other entities and objects will still be ticked.

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(yaw, pitch, on_ground, pushing_against_wall)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(yaw)
  buffer.write(pitch)

  if Client.protocol_version >= 769_u32
    flags = 0_u8
    if on_ground?
      flags = flags | 1_u8
    end
    if pushing_against_wall?
      flags = flags | 2_u8
    end
    buffer.write(flags)
  else
    buffer.write(on_ground?)
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(hand.value)

def.name: read
def.body:
count = io.read_var_int
if count == 0
  return new(count)
end

item_id_int = io.read_var_int


components_to_add_count = io.read_var_int
components_to_remove_count = io.read_var_int
components_to_add = Hash(UInt32, DataComponent).new

components_to_add_count.times do
  component_type = io.read_var_int
  structured_component = DataComponent.create_component(component_type, io)
  components_to_add[component_type] = structured_component
end


components_to_remove = Set(UInt32).new
components_to_remove_count.times do
  component_type = io.read_var_int
  components_to_remove.add(component_type)
end

new(count, item_id_int, components_to_add, components_to_remove)

def.name: damage
def.body:
damage_component = components_to_add[DataComponentType::Damage.value]?
if damage_component.is_a?(DataComponents::Damage)
else
  return 0
end
damage_component.value.to_i32

def.name: decrement
def.body:
if count <= 0
  return
end
@count = @count - 1
if count <= 0
  make_empty
end

def.name: enchantments
def.body:
enchant_component = components_to_add[DataComponentType::Enchantments.value]?
if enchant_component.is_a?(DataComponents::Enchantments)
else
  return Hash(String, Int8 | Int16 | Int32 | Int64 | UInt8).new
end

result = Hash(String, Int8 | Int16 | Int32 | Int64 | UInt8).new
enchant_component.enchantments.each do |type_id, level|

  enchantment = MCData::DEFAULT.enchantments.find do |e| e.id == type_id end
  enchant_name = enchantment ? enchantment.name : "enchant_#{type_id}"
  result[enchant_name] = level.to_i32
end
result

def.name: item
max_durability
def.body:
max_damage_component = components_to_add[DataComponentType::MaxDamage.value]?
if max_damage_component.is_a?(DataComponents::MaxDamage)
  max_damage_component.value.to_u16
else
  item.max_durability || 0_u16
end

def.name: max_stack_size
def.body:
max_stack_component = components_to_add[DataComponentType::MaxStackSize.value]?
if max_stack_component.is_a?(DataComponents::MaxStackSize)
  max_stack_component.value.to_u8
else
  item.stack_size
end

def.name: repair_cost
def.body:
repair_component = components_to_add[DataComponentType::RepairCost.value]?
if repair_component.is_a?(DataComponents::RepairCost)
else
  return 0
end
repair_component.cost.to_i32

def.name: swap_with
def.body:
tmp = self.item_id_int
self.item_id_int = other.item_id_int
other.item_id_int = tmp

tmp = @count
@count = other.count
other.count = tmp

tmp = @components_to_add
@components_to_add = other.components_to_add
other.components_to_add = tmp

tmp = @components_to_remove
@components_to_remove = other.components_to_remove
other.components_to_remove = tmp

def.name: worth_repairing?
def.body:
if (name.includes?("diamond")) || (name.includes?("netherite"))
else
  return false
end

enchanted? && repair_cost <= 31

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(count)
if count == 0
  return
end

io.write(item_id_int)


io.write(components_to_add.size)

io.write(components_to_remove.size)

components_to_add.each do |component_type, component|
  io.write(component_type)

  component.write(io)
end


components_to_remove.each do |component_type|
  io.write(component_type)
end

def.name: from_nbt
def.body:
case nbt
when Minecraft::NBT::StringTag
  TextComponent.new(nbt.value)
when Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag
  from_compound_nbt(nbt)
when Minecraft::NBT::ListTag
  component = TextComponent.new("")
  component.extra = nbt.value.map do |tag| from_nbt(tag) end
  component
else
  TextComponent.new(nbt.to_s)
end

def.name: to_nbt
def.body:
if simple_text_component?
  return Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(text || "")
end


compound = Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag.new


if text_val = text
  compound.value["text"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(text_val)
end
if translate_val = translate
  compound.value["translate"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(translate_val)
end
if selector_val = selector
  compound.value["selector"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(selector_val)
end
if keybind_val = keybind
  compound.value["keybind"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(keybind_val)
end
if nbt_val = nbt
  compound.value["nbt"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(nbt_val)
end
if block_val = block
  compound.value["block"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(block_val)
end
if entity_val = entity
  compound.value["entity"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(entity_val)
end
if storage_val = storage
  compound.value["storage"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(storage_val)
end
if font_val = font
  compound.value["font"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(font_val)
end


if bold == true
  compound.value["bold"] = Minecraft::NBT::ByteTag.new(1_u8)
end
if italic == true
  compound.value["italic"] = Minecraft::NBT::ByteTag.new(1_u8)
end
if underlined == true
  compound.value["underlined"] = Minecraft::NBT::ByteTag.new(1_u8)
end
if strikethrough == true
  compound.value["strikethrough"] = Minecraft::NBT::ByteTag.new(1_u8)
end
if obfuscated == true
  compound.value["obfuscated"] = Minecraft::NBT::ByteTag.new(1_u8)
end
if interpret == true
  compound.value["interpret"] = Minecraft::NBT::ByteTag.new(1_u8)
end


if color_val = color
  compound.value["color"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(color_val)
end


if insertion_val = insertion
  compound.value["insertion"] = Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(insertion_val)
end


if with_args = self.with
  with_array = [] of Minecraft::NBT::Tag
  with_args.each do |arg|
    case arg
    when String
      with_array << (Minecraft::NBT::StringTag.new(arg))
    when TextComponent
      with_array << arg.to_nbt
    end
  end
  compound.value["with"] = Minecraft::NBT::ListTag.new(with_array)
end


if extra_components = self.extra
  extra_array = [] of Minecraft::NBT::Tag
  extra_components.each do |extra|
    extra_array << extra.to_nbt
  end
  compound.value["extra"] = Minecraft::NBT::ListTag.new(extra_array)
end

compound

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a short String representation of this object
which includes its class name and its object address.

```
class Person
  def initialize(@name : String, @age : Int32)
  end
end

Person.new("John", 32).to_s # => #<Person:0x10a199f20>
```
instance_methods.summary: Appends a short String representation of this object which includes its class name and its object address.

def.name: to_s
def.body:
if translate_key = translate
  if with_args = self.with
    begin
      translation = TRANSLATIONS[translate_key]?
      if translation
        args = with_args.map(&.to_s)
        io << (translation % args)
      else
        io << translate_key
      end
    rescue ex : ArgumentError
      Log.warn do "Translation error: #{translate_key} with #{with_args.map(&.to_s)}" end
      io << translate_key
    end
  else
    translation = TRANSLATIONS[translate_key]?
    if translation
      io << translation
    else
      io << translate_key
    end
  end
elsif score_component = self.score
  io << "#{score_component.name}:#{score_component.objective}"
elsif selector
  io << selector
elsif keybind
  io << keybind
elsif nbt
  io << nbt
else
  io << (text || "")
end


extra.try(&.each do |component| io << component.to_s end)

case face
when BlockFace::West, BlockFace::East
  self.class.new(value, y, z)
when BlockFace::Bottom, BlockFace::Top
  self.class.new(x, value, z)
when BlockFace::North, BlockFace::South
  self.class.new(x, y, value)
else

end

def.name: with_length
def.body:
my_length = self.len
if my_length === 0
  self.to_f64 * 0
else
  self.to_f64 * (length / my_length)
end

def.name: drop
def.body:
slot = slots[slot_number]
if slot.slot_number < 0
  slot = cursor
  send_click(ClickWindow.drop_cursor(self, stack_mode))
else
  send_click(ClickWindow.drop(self, slot_number, stack_mode))
end
case stack_mode
when :single
  slot.decrement
when :full
  slot.make_empty
end

def.name: drop_cursor
def.body:
send_click(ClickWindow.drop_cursor(self, stack_mode))
case stack_mode
when :single
  cursor.decrement
when :full
  cursor.make_empty
end

def.name: handle_closed
main_hand
def.body:
selection = @client.player.hotbar_selection

selection = selection.clamp(0_u8, 8_u8)

if selection < hotbar.size
  hotbar[selection]
else
  hotbar[0]? || (WindowSlot.new(0, Slot.new))
end
